definition: regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
law
surname Lü
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse
verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律

sentences.english: The modern metrical poetry together with the free verse achieved the great brilliance in one-hundred-year Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 现代格律诗与自由诗共同创造了百年现代汉诗的辉煌。

sentences.english: He has composed 52 moderhythmical poems which can be classified into the styles of neat speech and mixed speech.
sentences.chinese: 他创作现代格律诗52首，分齐言体和杂言体两大类。

sentences.english: In the history of contemporary literature, the theory of modern metrics raised by He Qifang is of great impact.
sentences.chinese: 他提出的现代格律诗理论在现当代文学史上影响较大。

sentences.english: The central issue of modern metrical poetry is the artistic experiment.
sentences.chinese: 现代格律诗建设的中心问题是艺术实验。

sentences.english: In general, Wei Xian was better at poetic writing, and there were some excellent poems in his regulated verses.
sentences.chinese: 总体而言，魏宪更擅长诗歌创作，且其律诗颇有佳篇。

sentences.english: Unlike free verse , they are traditional metrical verses and semi-metrical verses.
sentences.chinese: 不同于新诗，它们是旧体或变体的格律诗。

sentences.english: QiLu'poem has a long development stage from beginning to aging.
sentences.chinese: 七言律诗自萌芽至成熟，经历了一个漫长的发展阶段。

sentences.english: The two versions dealing with the verse part in the novel should take the credit.
sentences.chinese: 这两个全译本对律诗部分的处理可说是可圈可点。

sentences.english: Art of composition of Du Fu's metrical verses show different structures because of different materials.
sentences.chinese: 杜甫律诗的章法，因题材不同而表现为不同的格局。

definition: a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
forms of versification/conventions regarding set number of words and lines, choice of tonal patterns and rhyme schemes for various types of Classical Chinese poetic composition/metrical verse
verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
long poem in lüshi form 律詩|律诗
meters and forms of versification/prosody
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
poetic form or genre
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
quatrain (poetic form)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse
poetry in the old style
number of sentences/number of lines (in verse etc)
names of the tunes to which 詞|词[ci2] poems are composed
same as 近體詩|近体诗[jin4 ti3 shi1]
